intro: Pauletia bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored pauletia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features bi-colored flowers, typically white and yellow, which bloom in clusters atop slender stems. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Pauletia bicolor is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
